paper_metadata.title: Evaluation of Sembrando Oportunidades Familia por Familia (SOF) program in Paraguay

component_a_cash_support.cash_evidence_citation: Specifically, the graduation approach is an integrated intervention that focuses on five elements: asset transfer, consumption support, savings, technical training, and life skills development.

component_b_assets.assets_evidence_citation: The fact that this increased income does not directly translate into increased expenditure can be attributed to the positive effect on the households' assets (mainly livestock) and savings.

study_characteristics.outcomes_evidence_citation: To better understand and discuss the specific effects of the program, the following subsections detail the outcomes for the program's effect on the selected variables: households' poverty level, assets, income, working hours, savings, expenditure, food security, well-being perception, and empowerment.
study_characteristics.design_evidence_citation: We exploit the original random assignment to run an impact evaluation through the instrumental variable (IV) methodology.

bonus_information.cost_mentions: Around US$1,500 per participant, including cash transfer, coaching, and logistics
bonus_information.cost_evidence_citation: This type of intervention could cost around US$1,500 per participant, including the cash transfer, coaching, and logistics.

evidence_citations.program_name_citation: Rural poverty in Paraguay led to the implementation of the 'Sembrando Oportunidades Familia por Familia' program (SOF), an initiative based on the graduation approach
evidence_citations.country_citation: Rural poverty in Paraguay led to the implementation of the 'Sembrando Oportunidades Familia por Familia' program (SOF)
evidence_citations.target_population_citation: Rural poverty in Paraguay led to the implementation of the 'Sembrando Oportunidades Familia por Familia' program (SOF)
